  name={<><a href="#afaea792ba3c9036a33d483f4a7516f9b">EmptyDbgMarker</a></>}>
We generally act like all llvm Instructions have a range of DbgRecords attached to them, but in reality sometimes we don&#39;t allocate the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgmarker">DbgMarker</a> to save time and memory, but still have to return ranges of DbgRecords. <a href="#afaea792ba3c9036a33d483f4a7516f9b">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

Per-instruction record of debug-info.

If an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> is the position of some debugging information, it points at a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgmarker">DbgMarker</a> storing that info. Each marker points back at the instruction that owns it. Various utilities are provided for manipulating the DbgRecords contained within this marker.

This class has a rough surface area, because it&#39;s needed to preserve the one arefact that we can&#39;t yet eliminate from the intrinsic / dbg.value debug-info design: the order of records is significant, and duplicates can exist. Thus, if one has a run of debug-info records such as: dbg.value(... foo = barinst dbg.value(... and remove barinst, then the dbg.values must be preserved in the correct order. Hence, the use of iterators to select positions to insert things into, or the occasional InsertAtHead parameter indicating that new records should go at the start of the list.

There are only five or six places in LLVM that truly rely on this ordering, which we can improve in the future. Additionally, many improvements in the way that debug-info is stored can be achieved in this class, at a future date.

Definition at line 583 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugprograminstruction-h">DebugProgramInstruction.h</a>.

### absorbDebugValues() {#ab72d53ec1bee5605dfe12b8b594f40f5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::DbgMarker::absorbDebugValues (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgmarker">DbgMarker</a> &amp; Src, bool InsertAtHead)</>}>
Transfer any DbgRecords from <code>Src</code> into this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgmarker">DbgMarker</a>.

If <code>InsertAtHead</code> is true, place them before existing DbgRecords, otherwise afterwards.

### cloneDebugInfoFrom() {#a4d1ce6143d40c11fda669dd0a3a7fd4f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>iterator&#95;range&lt; simple&#95;ilist&lt; DbgRecord &gt;::iterator &gt; llvm::DbgMarker::cloneDebugInfoFrom (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgmarker">DbgMarker</a> &#42; From, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/simple-ilist">simple&#95;ilist</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgrecord">DbgRecord</a> &gt;::iterator &gt; FromHere, bool InsertAtHead=false)</>}>
Clone all DbgMarkers from <code>From</code> into this marker.

There are numerous options to customise the source/destination, due to gnarliness, see class comment. <code>FromHere</code> If non-null, copy from FromHere to the end of From&#39;s DbgRecords <code>InsertAtHead</code> Place the cloned DbgRecords at the start of StoredDbgRecords 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
Range over all the newly cloned DbgRecords
</SectionUser>

### removeMarker() {#a98eceec46c49f571b3413d3f91e31e10}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::DbgMarker::removeMarker ()">
Handle the removal of a marker: the position of debug-info has gone away, but the stored debug records should not.

Drop them onto the next instruction, or otherwise work out what to do with them.

### StoredDbgRecords {#acf93a5910e8b1adcdca71705495e5d92}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>simple&#95;ilist&lt;DbgRecord&gt; llvm::DbgMarker::StoredDbgRecords</>}>
List of DbgRecords, the non-instruction equivalent of llvm.dbg.

<ul>
<li>intrinsics. There is a one-to-one relationship between each debug intrinsic in a block and each <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgrecord">DbgRecord</a> once the representation has been converted, and the ordering is meaningful in the same way.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugprograminstruction-h/#l00594">594</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugprograminstruction-h">DebugProgramInstruction.h</a>.

## Public Static Attributes

### EmptyDbgMarker {#afaea792ba3c9036a33d483f4a7516f9b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="DbgMarker llvm::DbgMarker::EmptyDbgMarker"
  labels = {["static"]}>
We generally act like all llvm Instructions have a range of DbgRecords attached to them, but in reality sometimes we don&#39;t allocate the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgmarker">DbgMarker</a> to save time and memory, but still have to return ranges of DbgRecords.

When we need to describe such an unallocated <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgrecord">DbgRecord</a> range, use this static markers range instead. This will bite us if someone tries to insert a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dbgrecord">DbgRecord</a> in that range, but they should be using the Official (TM) API for that.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugprograminstruction-h/#l00659">659</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/debugprograminstruction-h">DebugProgramInstruction.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
